message:
Hi

I'm looking for a way of doing this :

I have two templates "base.html" and "mobile.html", these two are very different, and, following DRY, i added a "meta.html" template which is included (via "include") in the two first.

In this "meta.html" i have things like 

<meta property="og:title" content="{% block opengraph_title %}Foo bar !{% endblock %}" />

Now, for a page i have a template "mypage.html", which extends "base.html" (via "extends") and in it i want to override the "opengraph_title" block, so i add

{% block opengraph_title %}My Page !{% endblock %}

But it doesn't work. We can't touch blocks in includes.

If i just put the content of the "meta.html" in the "base.html" template, it works as wanted. But i don't want to do that....

Any idea on how to accomplish my wish ?

Thanks in advance
This sounds like a place to use a custom templatetag.
The meta fields wouldn't be pulled in via include, they would be an inclusion tag, and you could pass in that fields you want to override as tag arguments
It can be an idea but i don't see how to implement this particular one !
That would be functionally identical but much more complex
I'm not sure how to use inclusion tag with your method. I'll check this. Thanks !
